shortdesc.ph: Compression preference types for video encoding.
Compression preference type for video encoding.
Compression preference type for video encoding.
Compression preference type for video encoding.

plentry.pd: -1: (Default) Auto mode. The SDK automatically selects PreferLowLatency or PreferQuality based on the video scenario you set to provide the best user experience.
0: Low latency preference. The SDK compresses video frames to reduce latency. This preference is suitable for scenarios where smoothness is prioritized and some quality loss is acceptable.
1: High quality preference. The SDK compresses video frames while maintaining video quality. This preference is suitable for scenarios where video quality is a priority.
-1: (Default) Automatic mode. The SDK automatically selects PreferLowLatency or PreferQuality based on your video scenario to provide the best user experience.
0: Low latency preference. The SDK compresses video frames to reduce latency. Suitable for scenarios where smoothness is prioritized and some quality loss is acceptable.
1: High quality preference. The SDK compresses video frames while maintaining video quality. Suitable for scenarios where video quality is prioritized.
-1: (Default) Automatic mode. The SDK automatically selects preferLowLatency or preferQuality based on your video scenario to provide the best user experience.
0: Low latency preference. The SDK compresses video frames to reduce latency. This preference is suitable for scenarios where smoothness is prioritized and some quality loss is acceptable.
1: High quality preference. The SDK compresses video frames while maintaining video quality. This preference is suitable for scenarios where video quality is prioritized.
-1: (Default) Auto mode. The SDK automatically selects PREFER_LOW_LATENCY or PREFER_QUALITY based on your video scenario settings to provide the best user experience.
0: Low latency preference. The SDK compresses video frames to reduce latency. This is suitable for scenarios where smoothness is prioritized over quality.
1: High quality preference. The SDK compresses video frames while maintaining video quality. This is suitable for scenarios where video quality is prioritized.
